author: AccessWDUN Staff
title: Sewanee blanks Piedmont men's soccer, 2-0
text:
Monday October 5th, 2015 3:22PM Posted 9:50AM on Monday 5th October 2015 ( 5 hours ago ) Sewanee blanks Piedmont men's soccer, 2-0 By AccessWDUN Staff Related Articles UNG's Sayre honored as Peach Belt Conference Goalkeeper of the Week Piedmont women's soccer edges out top 25 battle with Berry No. 19 Lady Nighthawks continue road swing with 3-0 win over Converse Piedmont women's soccer downs Bridgewater, 2-1 
DEMOREST — A day after picking up a key victory in conference play, the Piedmont College men's soccer team fell in non-conference action Sunday afternoon to the visiting Tigers of Sewanee 2-0 at Walker Athletic Complex. 
The Tigers used a score in each half to pick up the win, their second in their last three contests to go with a 4-0 win at Berea a week ago today. The loss for Piedmont is the first in regulation since September 19 when the Lions dropped a 5-2 decision to North Carolina Wesleyan College. 
Scoring for Sewanee was Ramsey Seagle and Luke Deimer with Seagle picking up his in the first half on a deflected save while Deimer earned his on a header off a service from Ryan MacDonald in the opening 20 minutes of the second half to seal the 2-0 win for the Tigers Associated Tags : college soccer, Piedmont men's soccer, Piedmont athletics © Copyright 2015 AccessWDUN.com
